alert.note: Alert for Johnson County Higher Elevations; Newton County Higher Elevations; Pope County Higher Elevations; Southern Johnson County (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 4:41AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Newton, northeastern Johnson and north central Pope Counties through 515 AM CDT... At 441 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Rosetta, or 12 miles northeast of Clarksville, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bertha... Dillen... Rosetta... Ben Hur... Cowell... Fort Douglas... Sand Gap... Ozone... Hillcrest in Johnson County... Haw Creek Falls Campground... Lurton... Mineral Springs Recreation Area... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 AM CDT for western and central Arkansas.

area.areaDesc: Johnson County Higher Elevations; Newton County Higher Elevations; Pope County Higher Elevations; Southern Johnson County
